image.altText: A tree with its branches down on the ground at Henley Beach

props.synopsis: Destructive winds sweeping across South Australia have damaged roofs, fences and caused power outages, with the BOM recording two "likely" tornadoes in Adelaide's northern suburbs.

title.children: Two small and fast-moving tornadoes 'likely' hit Adelaide's northern suburbs

image.altText: An aerial image of sheep and a tractor in a dusty paddock.

props.synopsis: The federal government announces an additional $1 billion for farm drought loans and commits to continuing the scheme beyond 2026.

title.children: Drought assistance extended with $1b for Victorian, SA farmers

image.altText: Matthew Draganoff in front of a Union Jack flag

props.synopsis: The brother of a man murdered by his landlord in 2021 has told the man responsible he had taken "the heart and soul of a family" and could not "unsee" the harrowing footage of the victim's final moments.

title.children: 'How could you possibly do this to our family?' Impact statements read to landlord who murdered man

image.altText: Three men and two women sitting at a long white desk

props.synopsis: Two energy companies that were set to benefit from a more than $5 billion desalination plant and water pipeline have pulled out, prompting questions over the project's final cost and feasibility.

title.children: Private backers exit from SA’s $5 billion Northern Water project

image.altText: A man in a suit walks out of a court building with glass doors

props.synopsis: Political experts, politicians and the public say a by-election should be held in the state seat of Mount Gambier ahead of the South Australian state election in seven months to make sure the city is represented in parliament.

title.children: Guilty South Australian MP's exit set to spark by-election

image.altText: A stone building with large columns

props.synopsis: A disability carer who killed her client in a crash south of Adelaide when she "lost control" and mistakenly hit the accelerator instead of a brake has been spared an immediate jail term.

title.children: Disability carer sentenced for killing client in 'terrible accident'

image.altText: Dead globefish covered in sand on beach.

props.synopsis: Scientific efforts are getting microscopic on the biggest algal bloom in Australia’s history to see if it hides secrets that could stop its spread.

title.children: 'Frighteningly complex': Scientists race to find solution to algal crisis

image.altText: A white woman wearing a white top and blue jeans raises her hands and sings on stage

props.synopsis: A remote kids choir and a large outback music festival are keen to continue their partnership after successful performances in far west New South Wales.

title.children: Outback children's choir thrives under festival 'special' partnership

image.altText: A man sits on a couch, looking to the side with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Seven years ago Richard Boyle's home was raided after he spoke out about heavy-handed debt collection tactics at the Australian Taxation Office. Now the whistleblower's case has finally closed, as he walks from court with a one-year good behaviour bond.

title.children: ATO whistleblower's 'suffered' for years since AFP raids

image.altText: Four Giant Australian cuttlefish are seen close up at a low angle under water. they are purple and grey in colour.

props.synopsis: A highly experimental, nearly $700,000 "bubble curtain" will be installed next week hoping to protect cuttlefish and their eggs in the Upper Spencer Gulf from South Australia's toxic algal bloom.

title.children: 'Bubble curtain' to protect giant Australian cuttlefish from algal bloom

image.altText: A screenshot of a woman inside a clinic with a graphic behind her 'Building a bigger health system'

props.synopsis: South Australians are seeing more advertising on their screens promoting the state government's infrastructure projects and health spending, prompting questions over the line between political and government advertising.

title.children: SA government accused of 'spruiking' its agenda in taxpayer-funded ads

image.altText: A woman and man hold each other surrounded by a crowd.

props.synopsis: Australian Taxation Office whistleblower Richard Boyle has avoided convictions and a jail sentence, seven years after publicly exposing aggressive debt collection practices at the tax office.

title.children: ATO whistleblower Richard Boyle spared convictions, jail sentence

image.altText: A diver holding a tape measure next to a rocky structure in a lake

props.synopsis: One of Australia's best-known divers, Richard Harris, was among those given a rare glimpse below Mount Gambier's major water source and tourist attraction.

title.children: Divers given rare chance to plunge below surface of mysterious lake

image.altText: A group of people in orange uniforms cheering around a small flat vehicle with solar panels on top

props.synopsis: Dutch team Brunel has been crowned the winners of the 2025 World Solar Challenge after a five-day marathon race across the Australian outback.

title.children: Dutch team 'back from the ashes' of 2019 fire to win World Solar Challenge

image.altText: APY Lands general manager Richard King.

props.synopsis: The South Australian government says it will appoint administrators to run the remote APY Lands in the state's Far North amid concerns over governance.

title.children: SA government to appoint administrators to run APY Lands

image.altText: A female with dark hair smiles and waves at the camera

props.synopsis: Thailand's Constitutional Court dismisses Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra from office for an ethics violation after only a year in power.

title.children: Thai court sacks PM Paetongtarn Shinawatra

image.altText: A group of Aboriginal mourners walking through a coles supermarket, while holding branches.

props.synopsis: Almost 80 Northern Territory lawyers have written to the government calling for "external oversight" in the investigation into Kumanjayi White's death in custody, and for the officers involved to be stood down during the probe.

title.children: Lawyers call for police involved in Kumanjayi White's death to be suspended

image.altText: A man wearing a suit and tie talks into a microphone

props.synopsis: Former Victorian premier Dan Andrews was also included on a guest list released by China's assistant foreign minister.

title.children: Bob Carr looking forward to attending major Chinese military parade

image.altText: A baggy green cricket cap with a crest and the years 1946-47 embroidered on the front.

props.synopsis: One of 11 known baggy green caps worn by Australian cricket great Sir Donald Bradman is bought by the National Museum of Australia for $438,550 at auction, with a federal government contribution covering half the cost.

title.children: Don Bradman's baggy green bought for over $400,000 by National Museum

image.altText: Close up shot of a Aus Post express post package

props.synopsis: Australia Post's chief executive defends the postal carrier's decision to immediately halt most shipping to the United States, just four days before a tariff deadline on low-value packages arriving there came into play.

title.children: Australia Post warns of 'intensifying structural headwinds' despite small profit

image.altText: An elderly man in silhouette sitting in a chair looking at trees.

props.synopsis: The government promised to release 83,000 packages to help clear the lengthy waitlist for at-home supports in July, but the extra packages have been pushed back to November.

title.children: More than 120,000 older Australians waiting to be assessed for at-home support

image.altText: Human waste fills to the top of a plane toilet

props.synopsis: Virgin Australia has apologised after passengers on a flight from Bali to Brisbane overnight were left without any working toilets during what one described as "a filthy, humiliating nightmare".

title.children: 'One elderly woman wet herself': Passengers 'distressed' after plane's toilets stop working

image.altText: Melatonin gummies for sale online.

props.synopsis: Many Australian families use melatonin supplements to help their kids get a good night's sleep. But new data shows a concerning spike in overdoses among children taking the gummies.

title.children: US-based online retailer bans melatonin sales to Australia after jump in child overdoses

image.altText: A CCTV footage with a person in camoflague.

props.synopsis: New Zealand father Tom Philips disappeared into the rugged wilderness just before Christmas 2021 with his three children.

title.children: NZ fugitive reportedly caught on camera after four years on the run

image.altText: The exterior of an ANZ Bank branch.

props.synopsis: Chief executive Nuno Matos says the bank is going to ensure the "indefensible and deeply disappointing" emails are not repeated.

title.children: ANZ CEO says automated redundancy email was 'indefensible'

image.altText: A man holding a firearm smiling and wearing ear muffs

props.synopsis: An army reservist with access to high-powered firearms is found guilty of threatening a senior WA Police officer over his involvement in the state's firearm reforms.

title.children: Gun enthusiast who told police officer 'we're coming for you' faces jail

image.altText: A court sketch of a middle-aged man with short dark hair wearing a suit and tie.

props.synopsis: A vengeful man who fired a shotgun through a bedroom window in suburban Perth, killing an innocent man, is sentenced to life imprisonment with a 22-year minimum for murder.

title.children: Vengeful killer who shot dead innocent man in his own bedroom jailed

image.altText: Dave Hughes laying in a hospital bed

props.synopsis: Dave Hughes is rushed to hospital by his wife after coming in for some heavy contact during the AFL Legends game at Docklands Stadium.

title.children: 'He couldn't breathe': Dave Hughes ends up in hospital after AFL Legends game

image.altText: Two men at a podium in the Prime Minister's Courtyard.

props.synopsis: After months of painstaking investigation, Australia's top spooks last week unpicked the thread confirming a link between the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps and antisemitic attacks in Sydney and Melbourne.

title.children: How Iran's antisemitic attack plot came undone

image.altText: Volodymyr Zelenskyy, wearing a plain black jumper, speaks into a mic in front of an ornate background, next to a Ukrainian flag.

props.synopsis: Ukraine hasn't held a presidential election since 2019. International law experts say it's "ultimately not safe" until a peace agreement is reached with Russia.

title.children: Zelenskyy told Trump 'you can't have elections' during a war. Is this true?

image.altText: Robbins Island, Tasmania

props.synopsis: A 100-turbine wind farm, the largest in Tasmania, will be built on Robbins Island in north-west Tasmania following seven delays to the decision, and multiple court appeals.

title.children: Robbins Island wind farm approved after years of delays

image.altText: Dead globefish covered in sand on beach.

props.synopsis: Scientific efforts are getting microscopic on the biggest algal bloom in Australia’s history to see if it hides secrets that could stop its spread.

title.children: 'Frighteningly complex': Scientists race to find solution to algal crisis

image.altText: Caucasian man with a fair complexion with reddish /sandy hair and bluish-green eyes

props.synopsis: Maroochydore Magistrates Court hears a witness watched missing Brisbane man Andrew Burow being severely beaten on a video phone call.

title.children: Witness saw missing man beaten by 'weapons and instruments', court told

image.altText: A young man with a tattoo above his right eye takes a photo of himself.

props.synopsis: Prisoner Nicholas Aaron Scott was shot and killed by another man in a scuffle the morning after his escape from Royal Hobart Hospital, where he was meant to be handcuffed at all times.

title.children: Prison guard gave chase 'in socks' to hospital escapee
